column4: but I am unable to install the 64 bit version of any software, what could be the possible reason? Any suggestion?

Another thing, pls guide how to clear up the space in Root directory.
pls guide how to clear up the space in Root directory.
pls guide how to clear up the space in Root directory. it is getting full very fast
Both / and /root should be in the same drive. I am talking of the smae
enter "baobab" in the terminal
baobab leads me to disk analyser, I believe. What do i do next? how to clean up the unwanted files.
it is running. It saeems it is going to take some time b4 I know whats wrong where.
pretty snazzy lol
I came across "apt-get clean". Does it help?
it seems "apt-get clean"  cleans everything from /var/cache/apt/archives
apt-get clean deletes archived installation files
I would say no as I would guess they are only for backup purposes in the case of no internet connection, but as I say, I'm no expert
if so, no amount of deleting will solve the underlying problem
you could then sort that app out somehow
or terminate it as a temporary fix
